abstract: Richard Schmack, state's attorney for Dekalb County, Ill, says evidence has convinced him of innocence of Jack McCullough, convicted in 2012 of kidnapping and murder of 7-year-old girl in 1957; conviction was hailed at time as one of oldest cold cases in nation to result in arrest; Schmack announces he will not contest McCullough's motion to have conviction overturned.
lead_paragraph: The defendant, an ex-police officer, is seeking to have his conviction overturned in the case of a 7-year-old girl who was kidnapped and strangled.

headline.main: Wrong Man Convicted of 1957 Murder in Illinois, Prosecutor Says
headline.print_headline: Wrong Man Convicted of 1957 Murder in Illinois, Prosecutor Says

snippet: The defendant, an ex-police officer, is seeking to have his conviction overturned in the case of a 7-year-old girl who was kidnapped and strangled.
